channel.title: Do not have the correct permission for /var/www/html on whonix workstation
channel.description:
I'm able to write changes in the home directory, but when it comes to the /var/www/html folder, it's not allowing me to make any changes or create new files or folders. I can view the folders and files as well.
I have tried to add my [free netflix](http://movieseriesworld.com/) username to the group that it belongs to, but I get the message that I don't even have the correct permissions to change [android 9](http://techgeniuszone.com/post-for-android/) that inside the terminal. Please suggest what I should do to correct this. Thanks.
This is inside Whonix if that helps.

item.title: Do not have the correct permission for /var/www/html on whonix workstation
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Did you use any other Linux before using Whonix? Linux user rights can be hard at start. You’ll need to get familar with sudo / kdesudo.

Whonix is based on Debian.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Based_on_Debian

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Free_Support_Principle applies.

I mean: instructions for any Linux distribution here will most likely also work for Whonix.

Some hints. Assuming Whonix with XFCE…

kdesudo thunar

sudo mkdir -p /var/www/html

kdesudo mousepad /var/www/html/index.html

sudo addroup user www

Read full topic
item.source: Do not have the correct permission for /var/www/html on whonix workstation
